questions.text: What is the name of the van the two brothers, Ian and Barley, travel in?
questions.explanation:
Guinevere.

	The van was named by Barley. Tom Holland played Ian and Chris Pratt played Barley. They had previously appeared as Spider-Man and Star Lord in Marvel's "Avengers" movies together. The van has a Pegasus painted on both sides of it.

questions.text: What species are the two brothers?
questions.explanation:
Elf.

	The brothers were elves, but they were about the size of a typical human.  The brothers in this movie interact with several other species, including trolls, unicorns, and a manticore among others. They have a pet dragon as well.  The movie was the first Pixar movie not to have John Lasseter work on it in some form or fashion. He had left the company in 2018 but received credit for work he'd done on other movies released after.

questions.text: Whose birthday is depicted in the opening scenes?
questions.explanation:
Ian's.

	It was Ian's 16th birthday. He came downstairs wearing his father's sweatshirt which his mom, Laurel commented on.  Ian had never met his father, who had died before Ian was born. Laurel was voiced by Julia Louis-Dreyfus. Barley was his older brother, and Colt Bronco was Laurel's new boyfriend. Neither of the brothers liked him.

questions.text: Who owns Manticore's Tavern, where the brother's quest for the Phoenix gem they need begins?
questions.explanation:
Corey.

	Corey's name was short for Manticore, which was also her species. She was voiced by Octavia Spencer. Corey and Laurel became friends and set off to rescue Ian and Barley before they were injured on their quest.

questions.text: Using a spell to bring back their father, only half of him came back. Which half?
questions.explanation:
Legs.

	Wilden left the boys a spell to bring him back for a single day. The spell backfired though and only brought him back from the waist down. They started a quest to find a second Phoenix gem to attempt to bring back the other half of him. The gem he had left them disintegrated.

questions.text: Who gets shrunken down due to a miscast magic spell?
questions.explanation:
Barley.

	Ian was practicing his magic for when they found the gemstone. He was trying to make a gas can grow. Instead, be shrunk his brother. They ended up walking to a gas station, where they had a run-in with a biker gang made up of all fairies.  The issue happened when Wilden stepped on one of the fairies. The brothers had him dressed up with a stuffed sweater and sunglasses.  Grey Griffin voiced Dewdrop, the leader of the gang.

questions.text: John Ratzenberger has voiced a character in every single Pixar movie that had been released through "Onward". What character does he play in "Onward"?
questions.explanation:
Fenwick.

	Fenwick was a cyclops construction worker. Gaxton was a goblin pawnshop owner voiced by Tracey Ullman. Dewdrop was a pixie gang leader, voiced by Grey Griffin, and Gore was a faun police officer voiced by Ali Wong.  The role of Fenwick was a small one.

questions.text: What does Ian make the boat out of?
questions.explanation:
A cheese puff.

	Ian, using a spell from Barley, engorged one of their snacks. As they floated down a river, Barley kept snacking on the boat. The boat led them through an old cave. The cave however lead them to the sewer system, which put them back downtown with less than two hours before the spell to bring back their father wore off.

options: On the wall at her tavern
questions.explanation:
At a pawnshop.

	When Corey decided to stop sending people on quests and turned her tavern into a more family-friendly restaurant, she no longer needed the sword.  Known as Demon Crusher, she pawned the sword to help her cover some financial responsibilities. Before Laurel and Corey could go after the boys, they had to get the sword back.

questions.text: Do either of the boys get to see their father before the spell wears off?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Wilden was voiced by Kyle Bornheimer in the one scene he was in. Ian didn't get to see his father other than at a distance though, as he was fighting a dragon. Barley talked with him briefly as the sun set.  Barley managed to find the gem in an old fountain that was about to be torn down. The sewer had led them to the gem after all.  Bornheimer was also the narrator of the movie.
